summary: This is a grand jury subpoena issued by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York to Denise Johannes, Director of Corporations and Trademarks for the U.S. Virgin Islands, demanding corporate records for Maple, Inc. and Laurel, Inc. as part of a criminal investigation into violations including sex trafficking laws. The subpoena requests documents like certificates of incorporation and information on directors and officers, with a return date of August 16, 2019.

persons.name: Denise Johannes
persons.role: Director, Corporations and Trademarks Office of the Lt. Governor
persons.context: Recipient of the grand jury subpoena, directed to produce corporate records for Maple, Inc. and Laurel, Inc. as part of a federal criminal investigation.

persons.name: Geoffrey S. Berman
persons.context: Signed the cover letter and the subpoena as the United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York, overseeing the grand jury investigation.

persons.name: Assistant United States Attorney
persons.context: Issued the subpoena and signed the rider; name is redacted in the text but the role is clearly indicated.

connections.description: Berman is the United States Attorney overseeing the office, and the Assistant U.S. Attorney is working under his authority on this grand jury investigation.
The Assistant U.S. Attorney is issuing a legal demand (subpoena) to Johannes in her official capacity as a government records custodian.

events.title: Issuance of Grand Jury Subpoena
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office issued a grand jury subpoena to Denise Johannes demanding corporate records for Maple, Inc. and Laurel, Inc.

events.title: Subpoena Return Date
events.description: The deadline for Denise Johannes to either appear before the grand jury or produce the requested corporate records to the FBI.

locations: U.S. Courthouse, 40 Foley Square, Room 220, Manhattan, New York, NY
52E-1 Estate Thomas, St. Thomas, U.S. Virgin Islands 00802
9100 Havensight, Port of Sales, Suite 15/16, St. Thomas 00802, Virgin Islands, U.S.
26 Federal Plaza, Squad C-40, New York, NY 10278
One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, New York 10007
keyFacts: The subpoena is part of an active federal grand jury investigation into suspected felony violations, specifically citing statutes 18 U.S.C. §§ 371 (conspiracy), 1591 (sex trafficking), 1594(c) (attempt/conspiracy to commit sex trafficking), and 2422(b) (coercing a minor into prostitution).
The investigation is targeting two corporate entities, Maple, Inc. and Laurel, Inc., both located at the same address in St. Thomas, U.S. Virgin Islands.
The U.S. Attorney's office explicitly requested confidentiality, asking the recipient not to disclose the existence of the subpoena to any third party to preserve the investigation.
The subpoena demands all corporate records for the entities, including certificates of incorporation and identifying information on directors, officers, and owners.
The document shows coordination between the U.S. Attorney's Office in New York and the Virgin Islands government, indicating the investigation has a multi-jurisdictional scope.
